name: The Sanctuary House Hotel

reviews.text: Having read many despairing reviews about reasonably priced London hotels, I was delighted to stumble upon Sanctuary House through Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Shhhh ... keep it a secret!

likes.disliked: — Possible safety issue with unmonitored lift access from street level

reviews.title: Was booked 'tll collapsed, stayed elsewhere, but have some comments
reviews.text: Very centrally situated, but on a quiet street, I can't say the pub below gave me any problems, particularly as my room was on the second floor. My room was also right beside the lift, which gave me initial cause for concern, but it proved not to be a problem. Despite booking a single room, I received a twin, with a lovely big bathroom. Everything was clean and I was most appreciative of the air con.

reviews.title: This is a great small hotel!
reviews.text: I did have a slight concern about members of the public being able to step into the lift from the street and effectively bypass reception to gain access to the rest of the hotel, particularly at night and being on my own, but in larger hotels that's a problem too. Being round the corner from Scotland Yard has it's benefits, I guess!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just booked to go back in October and am hoping for a similarly positive experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic location near abbey in quiet street

likes.liked: — Great location to attractions, close to train station when working, good sized mordern room
likes.disliked: — English second language staff, poor breakfast buffet selection, noisy air conditioner, overflowing laundry service room, rooms next to lift are unacceptable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, I'd previously written a review and gave the hotel a 1 rating, but that was due to the apparent non-notification to hotels.com that the adjacent building had collapsed. Because I wasn't going to gamble that the hotel was going to be open by the time I got there, I booked elsewhere. However, while in London, I stopped by the Sanctuary House and looked around. I also talked to a person staying there. Here's what I found:
reviews.title: Central Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights beginning March 15, 2007. This is truly a wonderful little hotel. It is clean, comfortable, and safe. The location is simply superb. You know you've got a great place when you step out the door and see tour bus after tour bus lined up along the curb on the road in front of the hotel door. The buses are all there because the hotel is just one block away from Westminster Abbey. The hotel is also one block away from the St. James's Park tube stop. It is also an easy walk to Trafalgar Square passing the Horse Guards, #10 Downing Street, etc. We also walked to Buckingham Palace and to Piccadilly Circus and through St. James’s Park.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located above a Fuller's Pub which made it very handy for getting food or drinks. The door to the hotel is a separate entrance. Go past the doors to the pub and walk a couple of steps towards Westminster Abbey and the hotel door is right there. The hotel lobby is up the steps or you can take the lift. We got there before check-in time and the girl in the lobby kindly locked up our suitcases for us in a little closet so we could go across the street and get some lunch at the EAT restaurant. On our way back, we took a short little detour to walk past the "New Scotland Yard" revolving sign.
reviews.title: Loved it completely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room 405, a very nice room with windows that opened onto Dacre St. There was coffee and tea with creamer and sugar along with a biscuit in the room. They also supplied little bottles of lovely-smelling shampoo, soap, shower gel, and lotion each day. Since we stayed at the hotel in March during cold weather, we certainly appreciated the towel-warming rack. The shower had plenty of hot water and good water pressure. (There’s a trick to adjusting the temperature of the hot water. The handle on the right controls the temperature. ) We found the staff to be very helpful. One night we asked for an extra blanket as the weather had turned cold. (Being used to cold weather, the down comforter on the bed was too warm for us so we just wanted to use an extra blanket.) The girl at the front desk personally brought up a blanket as she told us that "housekeeping had already left for the day". That night, it sleeted and we were very happy she brought us the blanket!
reviews.title: Loved Sanctuary House

likes.liked: — Location; Pub downstairs; Proximity to Underground
likes.disliked: — there's a building under construction across the street

reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, great location
reviews.text: We had a couple of meals in the pub downstairs. Even though the pub was packed with locals, the people behind the bar were very helpful in explaining to us how to go about ordering drinks and food. We also asked for recommendations as to types of ale and lagers and they were very willing to share their knowledge. We followed their suggestions and were very pleased with all the food, ale, and lagers that we had. Also, it was fun to be part of the crowd of people happily watching football on TV after work.

Speaking of food, there are several little convenience stores in the area if you want to purchase a few things to snack on. Also, it is just a short walk from the hotel to Victoria Street which has many restaurants and pubs. A word of note, the EAT and Pret restaurants across the street close on the weekends so keep that in mind in planning your meals.
reviews.title: Great value hotel in the heart of Londn

likes.liked: — It was clean, comfortable and secure
likes.disliked: — Rooms a bit on the small side

reviews.text: A small hotel, steps from Westminster and the Tube which feels like a Bed and Breakfast. We stayed at the Sanctuary House in August 2007 after the recommendations from TripAdvisor.com.
reviews.title: Delivers affordable accomodation in London

reviews.text: The rooms were a normal size for a traditional London hotel and very reminiscent of a country Bed and Breakfast. By which it is meant that the decoration was homey, the closet was built in with no door, and the toiletries were sparse. The air conditioning worked great and there was always plenty of hot water for showers. Both important pluses in the U.K.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only concern was the low level of security with the elevator opening to a door opposite the pub without any oversight on use.
reviews.title: Still a great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The desk staff were helpful and the pub has free WiFi. The pub serves food and allows children.
reviews.title: August 5th - 12th Loved Our Stay

reviews.text: Let me further emphasize the convenience of the hotel. You are only steps from Westminster Abbey and a short walk to Buckingham Palace or the London Eye. St. James Park tube is a block away and gets you conveniently everywhere else.
reviews.title: Great facilities and location: highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sanctuary House in May 2007 for 4 nights and were very happy with our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. They let us check-in early (around noon). I had sent an email a few days before our arrival requesting early check-in and the hotel staff responded quickly that it should not be a problem. The hotel is one block from the St. James tube station and the bus stop is even closer (the buses are much more fun than the tube). The area is quiet, except for the tour buses that park along Tothill Street. Our room was in the back and very quiet. The beds and linens were very comfortable. We ate at the pub downstairs one night and the chicken pot pie was good. Based on reviews on this site (and the price) we did not eat breakfast there. EAT and Pret A Manger are very close and both have good breakfast sandwiches and muffins (about $12 for 2 people). The only downside was we could not get the internet to work (which would have cost $30 a day, if it worked)
reviews.title: Great Hotel in convenient, quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, location, location....as the Brit's would say, it was "brilliant". We booked the Sanctuary House based mainly on the reviews on the Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. We were in a standard double room on the 2nd floor, facing EAT for 4 nights. The room size was more than adequate, my husband and I never felt cramped. The bed was comfortable with nice bedding on it, there was a desk with mirror behind it, and another small table and chair in the room. A nice touch was the hot water kettle and tea, instant coffee, and hot chocolate that was provided and replenished daily, and a couple little bicuits too. As previously mentioned, our floor did squeek, but it was not bothersome. The street noise was not that bad, atleast from our room, and we only heard the construction one morning, after we were already awake. But, as previously mentioned by others, we were awakened by a horrendous noise in the middle of the night...which was the trash. Had I not read about it on this site, I think I would have been very startled and scared....it was VERY loud. I think we only heard it 2 nights though, not every night. Also, we slept with our window opened, not sure if we would have heard this with the window closed. We ate in the downstairs Pub several nights, and really enjoyed the food, the ale and the atmosphere. Our room rate did not include the breakfast, but we were given the option to buy it. We looked one morning, but decided to eat elsewhere.
reviews.title: Very pleased

likes.liked: — Location, downstairs Pub, adequate room space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic...just steps from the St. James Tube. Westminster Abbey and Big Ben/Houses of Parliament are just down the street, and just a little further is the London Eye. Also within a few blocks is the Chuchill Museum (very interesting), Trafalgar Square and the National Gallery. A short walk thru the lovely St. James Park (just up the street) brings you to Buckingham Palace.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!!

reviews.text: We would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Not my favorite hotel

reviews.text: P.S. Trying to load some nice pictures of the hotel and surrounding area, but am having trouble as this site only accepts 2Mb or below, and most of mine are above. Here are a few that it would load.
reviews.title: Great Location!

description: At the heart of Westminster lies the Sanctuary House - a warm and inviting hotel that offers fine food, great hospitality and top class accommodation. Our 34 beautifully appointed bedrooms feature all the comforts of home.All our stylish bedrooms are extremely well appointed, with ensuite bathrooms, flatscreen TVs and little luxuries to help you enjoy a special stay in Westminster.As a Fuller’s Ale & Pie House, we are famous for our fantastic homemade pies - an authentic taste of London. There's chef's specials too, and an ever-changing bar menu.One of the best hotels near Big Ben, the Sanctuary House is just a couple of minutes walk away. The most famous sight in Britain, virtually on our doorstep.
